greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of primes in sequence h(m) defined by h(1) = n, h(m+1) = Floor(h(m)/2).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
example: The sequence h(m) for n = 5 is 5, 2, 1, 0, 0, 0, ...., in which two terms are primes. Therefore a(5) = 2.
mathematica: f[n_] := Module[{i, p}, i = n; p = 0; While[i > 1, If[PrimeQ[i], p = p + 1]; i = Floor[i/2]]; p]; Table[f[i], {i, 1, 100}]
program: (definec (A078349 n) (if (<= n 1) 0 (+ (A010051 n) (A078349 (floor->exact (/ n 2)))))) ;; _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 01 2017
results.author: _Joseph L. Pe_, Dec 23 2002
